posts.content: Its cool that REACT can activate a Mac Mavericks Notification via Twitter!  I have several REACTs which are only true when the machine I am monitoring is ON.  When it is OFF, the REACTs are giving faulty Tweets.  Could you upgrade the REACT app to test for more than one condition with AND/OR?  Then I could condition the REACTs when the machine is ON.
posts.author: turgo

posts.content: Hi,Can I help figure out why the REACT is resulting in faulty Tweets?  What REACT ID are you referring to?  Feel free to email me: lee at iobridge dot com.Adding multiple conditions to REACT is something we will consider adding in the future.lee
posts.author: lee

posts.content: Thanks Lee for your kind offer of assistance.  The Tweets are faulty only in that they are initiated without considering if the machine is ON.  If you add multiple conditions to REACT, then I can correct the errant Tweets.
posts.author: turgo

posts.content: HelloI am learning how to use twitter to input data to my ThingSpeak channels.Can I send multiple values to my channel via tweeter?
posts.author: wiktor

posts.content: Hi,is there a reason why we can specify only one action in a REACT app?It would be very convenient to be able to specify multiple actions. To date, if I want to execute two actions when a certain condition is met, I need to create two identical REACTs and specify the different actions in one and the other.Would this be a big issue to implement in ThingSpeak?Ondrej

It seems I need to play some games with refreshing the screen or selecting the channel prior to entering data into any fields.  Looks like the Ajax behind the channel field is not firing when the field selection is changed.

posts.author: peterpan666

posts.content: I'm looking to send some data up from a Netduino, and also back down to it.Ideally, I'd like to send down field names as listed in the channel.  Can I use ThingHTTP to parse a feed.json from Thingspeak and send down just the field name string?
posts.author: H07R0D

posts.content: Yes this will work, try the following as an example.URL: http://api.thingspeak.com/channels/9/feed.xml?results=0parse: field1
posts.author: lee

posts.content: lee said: Yes this will work, try the following as an example.URL: http://api.thingspeak.com/channels/9/feed.xml?results=0parse: field1Thanks, I was just getting into that section.  XPath is pretty new to me, how would I return all fields instead just field1? edit: Just noticed the gravatar, I guess I should start being a dick now right?
posts.author: H07R0D

posts.content: Try using this parse string:/channel/field1 | /channel/field2
posts.author: lee

posts.content: That works just fine.I did end up getting just the field names by using:/channel/*[substring(name(),1, 5) = 'field']Can I also send a style sheet in  my request?  I'd like to format the output a bit to show:<1>Temperature</1><2>pH</2>Is that doable with the parse string, or can I add something to the body?
posts.author: H07R0D

posts.content: There are 2 fields (prepend and append) that will allow you to format the output, but they only allow you to format it at the beginning and the end, so you could do each request separately:http://api.thingspeak.com/apps/thinghttp/send_request?api_key=YOUR_API_KEY&prepend=<1>&append=</1> http://api.thingspeak.com/apps/thinghttp/send_request?api_key=YOUR_SECOND_API_KEY&prepend=<2>&append=</2> If you want this all as one request, you'll have to format the response on your end somehow, maybe by using:parse string: /channel/field1 | /channel/field2which should return: <field1>Temperature</field1><field2>pH</field2>and then removing all strings of 'field'. Edit: the > in the urls should be replaced by >, I can't get this forum to post it correctly.
posts.author: lee

posts.content: lee said Yes this will work, try the following as an example.URL: http://api.thingspeak.com/channels/9/feed.xml?results=0parse: field1it works for getting field name.. what parse string to be used to get value at that field.?
posts.author: Deepak

posts.content: Does anyone know how to use the ThingHttp app to get my longitude and latitude from Google Latitude? I just can't figure out how to return only longitude and latitude using the parse field. https://latitude.google.com/latitude/apps/badge/api?user=XXXXXXXXXX&type=jsonCurrent Results:{ 'type': 'FeatureCollection', 'features': [ { 'type': 'Feature', 'geometry': {'type': 'Point', 'coordinates': [-##.######, ##.#####]}, 'properties': { 'id': 'XXXXXXXXXX', 'accuracyInMeters': 10, 'timeStamp': 1359231515, 'reverseGeocode': My City', 'photoUrl': 'https://latitude.google.com/latitude/apps/badge/api?type=photo&photo=CeTdfTwBAAA.R7DLt91FDFDaMQukap5aXw.VC64Pqj9dyvuoH1pOAm3ew', 'photoWidth': 96, 'photoHeight': 96, 'placardUrl': 'https://latitude.google.com/latitude/apps/badge/api?type=photo_placard&photo=CeTdfTwBAAA.R7DLt91FDFDaMQukap5aXw.VC64Pqj9dyvuoH1pOAm3ew&moving=true&stale=true&lod=1&format=png', 'placardWidth': 56, 'placardHeight': 59 } } ] } Thanks
posts.author: cjm4909

posts.content: ThingHttp will only parse XML / HTML  It won't parse JSONWe're working on more flexible parsing, but I don't have any release targets yet.
posts.author: akinsgre

The React trigger is working with ThingTweet but I can't get ThingHTTP to send a message to Prowl.I have a Prowl API Key, I assume I have missed something in the setup:URL:  https://api.prowlapp.com/publicapi/addMETHOD: POSTContent Type:  application/x-www-form-urlencodedHTTP Version: 1.1Body:  apikey={mykey}&application=ThingHTTP&event=%%message%% Any ideas what I am doing wrong?

posts.content: I figured it out...never mind.

posts.content: This question has been asked a few times before, but I'm still struggling to get TweetControl to work.I've set up my channel (tried Public and not), added the ThingHTTP app, then the TweetControl app, but I can't get the Twitter statuses to go into the channel. I've recreated the example but still no joy.I can create a custom POST message direct to the ThingHTTP app and it goes through to the channel OK. The TweetControl app is not anonymous, the Twitter account is not protected. Have I missed anything?Thanks
posts.author: tonyf

posts.content: make sure you have your ThingHTTP setup with content type of application/x-www-form-urlencoded Not having that established is the issue I ran into when setting up TwitterControl.
posts.author: jpmurph

posts.content: I've have a working twitter control app which is now updating my thingspeak channel. I'm now working on an Arduino sketch which will listen to my thingspeak channel and... if the channel gets updated, then the LED on pin 13 will blink for a second.  I used the CheerLights Arduino Ethernet Sketch as a starting place, but I'm having an issue with creating with my void loop() I know it needs to be something like this, but really I have no idea. Could someone help point me in the right direction? void loop() {if (client.available()) {//Look for updates to channel digitalWrite(led, HIGH);   delay(1000);              digitalWrite(led, LOW);    delay(1000);
posts.author: jpmurph

posts.content: Hi jp...Sorry for the delay.I would check your constants and setup section.You need to specify which pin the LED is on and make sure the pin set to an OUTPUT. const int led =  13;void setup() {    pinMode(led, OUTPUT); }
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: I'm trying to make a new twitter control by following the tutorial in the documentation, but I'm having an issues. Should your first step be to create a channel, then thingHTTP, then twiterContorl?  I created all 3 and have tested sending at POST via poster (firefox pluging) and received teh 200 ok, but when I try sending  a tweet with the filter and trigger nothing gets posted to the channel.  Heres the details of my setup am I missing something?
posts.author: jpmurph

posts.content: I tihnk you are close...The Twitter Account field needs to just be your username (no @ symbol).What are you tweeting exactly?
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: ok got it to work removed '@' from twitter username and added content type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' to my connected ThingHTTP  That did the trick, thanks for the help. This is a relay killer service. Next step controlling the arduino connected via ethernet shield.
posts.author: jpmurph
